description: Instatiation of the Object Oriented Environmental Data System (OOEDS)
author: S.J.K. Mason

collections.description: An Activity procures or generates one or more Evaluations

properties.description: Auto-generated by MongoDB
properties.name: _id

properties.description: The specific Activity category or sub-class that inherits properties from the generic Activity class
properties.name: activity-type

properties.description: The unambiguous name of the Activity
properties.name: activity-name

properties.description: The description of the Activity that produced one or more Evaluations
properties.name: activity-description

properties.description: The Agent(s) primarily responsible for conducting the Activity
properties.name: agent

properties.description: The parent Activity under which this Activity is heirarchically nested
properties.name: parent-activity

properties.description: An undirected network of Activities
properties.name: network-activity

collections.description: An Agent may be an individual, an organization, a company, a government, etc.

properties.description: Auto-generated by MongoDB
properties.name: _id

properties.description: The specific category or sub-class of Agent that inherits properties from the generic Agent class
properties.name: agent-type

properties.description: The name of the individual, organization, etc.
properties.name: agent-name

properties.description: Contact telephone number for the Agent
properties.name: agent-phone

properties.description: Contact email for the Agent
properties.name: agent-email

properties.description: Contact physical address for the Agent
properties.name: agent-address

properties.description: The Agent under which this Agent is heirarchically nested
properties.name: parent-agent

properties.description: The non-heirarchical network of Agents this Agent is associated with
properties.name: network-agent

collections.description: The object or phenomena subjected to observation or measurement. An Evaluation describes an Entity.

properties.description: Auto-generated by MongoDB
properties.name: _id

properties.description: The specific Entity category or sub-class that inherits properties from the generic Entity class.
properties.name: entity-type

properties.description: The unique name for the Entity
properties.name: entity-name

properties.description: The unambiguous description of the Entity type
properties.name: entity-description

properties.description: The parent Entity under which this Entity is heirarchically nested
properties.name: parent-entity

properties.description: The non-heriarchical network of Entities of which this Entity is a part
properties.name: network-entity

collections.description: A representation of a measurement of a real-world concept. This is the fundamental abstraction of a “datum” that retains relationships to a limited number of categories of metadata that apply to any type of environmental data you can define

properties.description: Auto-generated by Mongo DB
properties.name: _id

properties.description: The name for the specific Evaluation sub-class that inherits properties from the abstract Evaluation
properties.name: evaluation-type

properties.description: The Activity that generated the Evaluation
properties.name: activity

properties.description: An Evaluation describes an Entities
properties.name: entity

properties.description: The Property evaluated for the Entity subjected to measurement or observation
properties.name: property

properties.description: The various Measurement-Contexts that make the data meaningful by providing reference frames for space, time, data quality, etc.
properties.name: measurement-context

properties.description: The read/write privileges on the Evaluation granted to various Agents.
properties.name: permissions

collections.description: The Measurement-Context provides information about the perspective or frame of reference (e.g. spatial and/or temporal, QAQC, etc.)  for the data

properties.description: Auto-generated by MongoDB
properties.name: _id

properties.description: The specific Measurement-Context sub-class that inherits properties from the abstract Measurement Context
properties.name: measurement-context-type

properties.description: The unambiguous definition of the Measurement-Context sub-class
properties.name: measurement-context-definition

collections.description: Including a Permissions object in the data model provides a mechanism for controlling read/write access at an extrememly granular level, which is not natively supported by MongoDB.

properties.description: Auto-generated by MongoDB
properties.name: _id

properties.description: User access levels
properties.name: permission-type

properties.description: The Agent the permissionType is assigned to
properties.name: permission-agent

collections.description: The characteristic of an Entity subjected to measurement or observation

properties.description: Auto-generated by MongoDB
properties.name: _id

properties.description: The unambiguous name for the property (e.g. water temperature, solar irradiance)
properties.name: property-type

properties.description: The dimensions(s) associated with the property (e.g. length, time, mass/time)
properties.name: property-dimensions

buckets.name: OOEDS MongoDB
buckets.description: A MongoDB instantiation of the OOEDS information metamodel.

relationships.name: Evaluation.Activity
relationships.description: An Evaluation is generated by an Activity

relationships.name: Activity.Parent
relationships.description: An Activity may belong to a nested hierarchy of Activities

relationships.name: Agent.Parent
relationships.description: An Agent may be a child of another Agent. This relationship is useful for mapping things lik employment of a "researcher" Agent by a "university" Agent.

relationships.name: Permission.Agent
relationships.description: Permissions describe the read/write priveledges of an Agent

relationships.name: Evaluation.Property
relationships.description: An Evaluation evaluates a Property of an Entity

relationships.name: Entity.Parent
relationships.description: An Entity may belong to a nested hierarchy of Entities
